channel.title: News/Events - Axoloti Community
channel.description:
Topics in the 'News/Events' category Meetups, workshops, presentations, all sort of events.
It's perfectly fine for users to announce and discuss their own events, as long as it is related to Axoloti somehow.
Start your topic title with the name of the area where your event will happen.

item.title: ContinuuCon 2023: Palmela, Portugal, May 17-19
item.dc:creator: @keyman Antonio Machado
item.description:
@keyman wrote:

Happy to announce and host in my town:

ContinuuCon Electronic Music Conference Scheduled in Portugal

ContinuuCon 2023, the fifth international Haken Continuum Conference, is slated for May 17–19 in Palmela, Portugal. This year’s focus will be on every electronic musical instrument that features the Continuum’s internal sound engine, the EaganMatrix. This includes the new Osmose synthesizer from French manufacturer Expressive E, as well as the Continuum Fingerboard, ContinuuMini, and EaganMatrix Module for Eurorack from Haken Audio. As in previous years, the conference extends opportunities for musicians, sound designers, software developers, and music enthusiasts to explore these uniquely expressive instruments through presentations, performances, and hands-on experience.

ContinuuCon 2023 will begin with an evening reception on May 17, just four days after Superbooth ends in Berlin. Over the next two days, Continuum and Osmose experts and master musicians will present lectures and demos at the Palmela Public Library. For tickets, information, and videos of past events, visit the website continuucon.com.

Over decades of collaboration, University of Illinois professor Dr. Lippold Haken and Canadian film and TV composer Edmund Eagan developed the EaganMatrix and the Continuum family of instruments. Both men will be on hand throughout the event, along with their counterparts from Expressive E and other authorities, to share their technical knowledge and musical expertise.

Previous Continuum conferences have been held at IRCAM in Paris and in Asheville, North Carolina. Haken Continuum players include Game of Thrones composer Ramin Djawadi, Brazilian electro-acoustic musician Amon Tobin, film composer A.R. Rahman, Dream Theater keyboardist Jordan Rudess, and The Who’s Pete Townshend, who said, “I absolutely adore it. The Continuum is already inspiring me to new ideas.”

About Haken Audio’s Instruments

The Continuum Fingerboard is a polyphonic electronic instrument that offers continuous multidimensional performance control by responding to each finger independently. The ContinuuMini is a smaller, more affordable duotactic model based on the same technology. Inside is the EaganMatrix, a user-programmable digital modular synthesizer taking full advantage of the supple playing surface’s myriad performance possibilities.

About Palmela, Portugal

About 25 miles from Lisbon, the city of Palmela features art, nature, heritage, gastronomy, award-winning wines, arts and crafts, and nearby, the beautiful beaches of the Arrábida, making it an excellent location for ContinuuCon. With the support of the Palmela City Council, Passos e Compassos is pleased to host ContinuuCon 2023.

More info/ tickets
www.ContinuuCon.com

Posts: 1

Participants: 1

Read full topic

item.title: RNBO ("rainbow"): compile to hardware, vsts
item.dc:creator: @Janko Jack
item.description:
@Janko wrote:

cdm.link

RNBO ("rainbow"): Start in Max's UI, deliver to plug-ins, Web browsers,...

The new Max thing Cycling '74 has been teasing is here, and it's pronounced "rainbow." Maybe the easiest way to see why this is a big deal: on the product page, you can mess with an interactive patch in your Web browser natively.

I'm not a Max user but this looks veeery cool, compiling to both hardware and vsts is quite the thing. Worth a look!

item.title: Striso board MPE controller - last day on Kickstarter!
item.dc:creator: @pierstitus
item.description:
@pierstitus wrote:

During this month I've been running a campaign on Kickstarter for taking the Striso board, a new MPE MIDI controller with pressure and direction sensitive buttons, motion sensor and a logical isomorphic note layout that gives a different view on understanding and experiencing music theory.

I use it mainly with the Axoloti, I feel it's a great match.

Only 24 hours to go to get a Striso board on Kickstarter!

(Should have posted here earlier of course, just realised I didn't post about the campaign here yet...)

kickstarter.com

Striso board: Musical expression taken to the next dimension

An expressive instrument/MIDI controller with an innovative note layout that helps understand music theory

Participants: 2

item.source: Striso board MPE controller - last day on Kickstarter!

item.title: Axoloti intro & workshop at Forum Lenteng, Jakarta
item.dc:creator: @joaogatao joaogatao
item.description:
@joaogatao wrote:

I will give an introduction to Axoloti to the art collective Forum Lenteng (https://forumlenteng.org/en/) in Jakarta on 13th November. They might use the Axoloti already for their upcoming event at Goethe Institut in Jakarta in the 69 Performance Club series; the next edition will concentrate on the use of sound in performance art.

I'll do the intro in two parts and let them play with the Axoloti and some electronic components between and after. The aim is to give them a basic understanding of what Axoloti can be used for and what not. Then it's up to them to decide if and how they want to use it of course.

Topics will include:
PART 1: Basic Synth & Controls
- Basic synth: oscillator - envelope - filter + MIDI controller input
- Analog GPIO: potentiometer, switches, light sensor
- Simple sequencer

PART 2: Samples, Loops & Effects
- single track looper for mic (audio) input
- drum machine with pre-recorded samples in .raw format
- effects: tremolo with LFO, panning with LFO, delay & echo, reverb, pitch-shifter, etc.

Their greatest interest goes out to the second part; the first part is more a vehicle to demonstrate some basic possibilities. However, the topics I address there are very very basic, since sampling is not really my area. I'm looking for other interesting techniques for sample manipulation now. If anyone has a nice idea or is willing to share an impressive patch that can be used with mic input, that would be very welcome, even after the date of the intro here.

Best!

Posts: 1

Participants: 1

Read full topic
item.source: Axoloti intro & workshop at Forum Lenteng, Jakarta

item.title: Axoloti at NIME 2018
item.dc:creator: @jfcharles Jean-Francois Charles
item.description:
@jfcharles wrote:

Hello,
I hope to meet other axoloti users at the New Interfaces for Musical Expression (NIME) conference in Blacksburg, VA (June 3-6).
I'll be performing a piece using an axoloti-based effects pedal (Concert 1), and presenting a short paper/poster titled "Using the Axoloti Embedded Sound Processing Platform to Foster Experimentation and Creativity" (Demo-Poster session 2).
Let me know if you are going,
All best,
Jean-Francois.

item.title: Axoloti masterclass - March 17 & 18 2018 at iMAL (Brussels)
item.dc:creator: @lhanneus Luc Hanneuse
item.description:
@lhanneus wrote:

In this 2 days masterclass artist and computational designer Jan Vantomme will share his knowledge on Axoloti, a new open-source platform to build synthesizers, drum machines, audio effects and other weird instruments. The platform consists of the Axoloti Core microcontroller board, and the Axoloti Patcher software.

The topics that he will address are:
* Basics of synth terminology: what is an oscillator, envelope or fillter?
* Sound design: what components to use to create a bassline, a lead sound or snare drum?
* Exploring rhythm: building sequencers and drum machines
* Audio effects: create effects like flangers, or delays for your synthesizer patches, or use the Axoloti board as an effects processor for guitars
* Controlling the Axoloti: connecting MIDI controllers or electronic components like buttons, potentiometers and distance sensors
* Strategies to use Axoloti to create an interactive audio installation.

This workshop is primarily aimed at artists, musicians and/or makers who want to learn about sound design, creating performance instruments or interactive audio installations.

The workshop is in English. Q/A can be in Dutch and French.

Price: 160€ for 2 days (including the Axoloti Core and a digital version of the book Getting Started with Axoloti).

More info: www.imal.org/en/masterclass/axoloti2018
Registration: www.imal.org/en/masterclass/axoloti2018/register

item.title: AXOLOTI Starters Workshop
item.dc:creator: @Jan1 Jan
item.description:
@Jan1 wrote:

Dear, I feel very tempted to start my own Axoliti adventure.
However, looking at all the topics on this forum, I'm missing clarity to make an easy start.
I would like to organize (or help to organize) a workshop for starters.
I was thinking of a 1 day workshop for max 10 people, €100 including an Axoloti (€65).
This would make it possible to fund venue, drinks, sandwich lunch, somebody with teaching/coaching skills, promotion for €350.
Timing/place: Opwijk, July 2017.
Anybody interested?
Cheers,
Jan

item.title: Amsterdam, January 13-15 2017, Synthethings
item.dc:creator: @dreamer
item.description:
@dreamer wrote:

We're organizing another synth-event at our hacklab in Amsterdam.
There is room for discussion, presentations and hands-on tinkering.
Expect some soldering, patching, tweaking, and noodling of audio waves that tickle your ear.

3 days of playing with audio stuff from diy electronics to patch environments like Pd and Axoloti.
On saturday we'll also have food in the local community kitchen.

Hope to see you there

https://laglab.org/
https://radar.squat.net/en/event/amsterdam/lag/2017-01-13/synthethings

LAG
Eerste Schinkelstraat 14-16
1075 TX Amsterdam

Auto://loop Performer Synth Your Music/Projects

item.title: 4 - 5 November 2016 - radical dB showcase - Zaragoza
item.dc:creator: @mtyas Matthew Tyas
item.description:
@mtyas wrote:

Hi,
Just a short message to say that I'll be performing on the 4th November during the radical dB showcase event, in Zaragoza, Spain.
I'll only be using my 5 Axoloti boxes (and a few midi controllers). I'll do a short talk after the performance, about the Axoloti's and the different ways that they can be used.
It open to anyone, and it's free. There will be some other very interesting performers too, all with original instruments or controllers.

Here's the link to the event : http://radicaldb.es/

If anyone from the forum is going, please introduce yourself, it would great to talk.

item.description:
@Blindsmyth wrote:

Hi,

there is a meetup of the Musical Instrument Makers group every Friday at the Fablab Berlin.
Me and a couple of other Berlin Axoloti Users will join there in the Future.

It is a really nice place with a lot of interesting tools like 3d printers, cutting machines etc. Feel free to join us there
